Description: Scarab carved from stone (maybe steatite ?); underside incised with raised cobra to left and oval (rather than cartouche) containing spiral motif to right, above neb-basket sign.
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Gardner (in Gardner 1888, pl. XVIII, no. 81). The motif of a spiral in an oval / "cartouche" above a neb-basket sign can be found on scarabs of the Second Intermediate Period (see for example Hornung and Staehelin 1976, 210, pl. 7, no. 100). Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Hornung, E., Staehelin, E. 1976. Skarabäen und andere Siegelamulette aus Basler Sammlungen, Ägyptische Denkmäler in der Schweiz I.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.66) (phase 3)
